page.title: 04HARRISTON
page.content: Mr. Harris, a coal mine owner built a village to house his miners and called it Harris Town. Later this became shortened to Harriston. The houses, in terraces, had no running water or toilets. The mine closed down in 1907. The local council decided that the village should be demolished and the people rehoused. However they petitioned to remain. A new village was built row by row. As one new terrace was completed, the residents moved across and their old houses were demolished. Then a new terrace was begun on the site.The new village was completed in 1977 and won awards from the Civic Trust for its design. It looks attractive with a variety of house styles and many green spaces, but some of the old residents say that they preferred it the old way.
